name: Moevenpick Hotel Frankfurt am Main City

reviews.text: This hotel is great! It's super clean, and has all the amenities you need/want. The staff are wonderful, multi lingual, and very helpful.
reviews.title: a very pleasant surprise!

reviews.text: The only thing you need to be aware of is the location. Although this hotel is very close to the metro, it is not in a very "happening" area. There is absolutely nothing around the hotel for you to do, so expect to have to take the train or walk.
reviews.title: Not a lot to say that hasn't already been said

reviews.text: This hotel is near the convention grounds, so it's a little out of the way. It's great if you have a car, or are there on business, but if you want more of a scene, there are better choices. That said, Frankfurt is a very walkable city with great public transportation, so I wasn't so disappointed. I could walk to the train station in the center of town in 10 minutes, and to the more touristy sections in 15. Or I could walk 5 minutes to the local subway. It really is 5 minutes though, not 30 seconds. Even better that there are often discounts on this hotel, so I got my room at a great price. For someone who doesn't usually stay in 4-star places... and was considering a hostel room for just a little less, I thought this was a steal. The bathroom with the heated tiles was a nice treat, as was the TV and wi-fi. Because I got my room at a discount though, I think they gave me a pretty bad room. I was a single traveler, but I wound up in a pretty small double facing the back. They did let me check in early without any hassle though. I guess I'm pretty satisfied, the trip was fun.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent hotel experience; great multilingual staff, spotless rooms, very good restaurant, access to tram, Ubahn.
reviews.title: Good for a convention, not really for tourism

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is next to the convention center (Feste Halle). It was a bit far from the touristy bits of Frankfurt. It was very clean and very quiet. If you can deal with the location its a good choice. It is very close to the U-Bahn.
reviews.title: High quality stay

reviews.text: I like this hotel, maybe the best I’ve stayed in a long time. My favorite amenity - they let me check in before noon. I had just got off a long, tiring flight, so I very much appreciated that. The room was very clean, stylish and comfortable. Everything was very nice & well maintained. They also provide free wifi. The staff and service was top class. The windows were floor to ceiling and wall to wall, so lots of light. They also opened for fresh air. The bath had a nice walk-in shower, but no tub. The TV had some English channels, CNN and occasionally BBC World News and CNBC. The elevators required a key card to access the upper floors, a nice security feature.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is on the back side of the Festhalle (concert hall). It is a five minute walk to the other side of the Festhalle. There are several transportation choices there – the U4 subway, streetcar lines 16 & 17, and also a bus for two bus lines. The main train station is one subway stop away or about three street car stops. There isn’t anything of interest next to the hotel, it’s a bit isolated. The hotel has a very nice, but pricey, restaurant. There are a couple of restaurant choices near the Festhalle subway stop. I ate mostly away from the hotel, in town.
reviews.title: New and modern hotel close to the exhibition area

reviews.text: A lot of the Frankfurt hotels are near the main train station, a pretty depressing area (drunks, junkies, red-light district clientele). Although the Moevenpick location is a little inconvenient for tourists, I enjoyed staying in it’s much better area.
reviews.title: Convenient Messe hotel

reviews.text: I chose to stay at the Moevenpick Hotel Frankfurt City because there was a conference at the exhibition area nearby. Depending where you are on the fair grounds, it will take you at most ten minutes by foot to reach the Moevenpick. It's about the same distance to the central station. I liked the design of the hotel very much. It's architecture is not groundbreaking but nice, the interior of the rooms is modern and stylish and not too cold. The staff is most friendly and the bar quite enjoyable. There are only two negative aspects I have to mention: First, the size of the standard room, which is quite small. Second, there is a large construction site nearby witk work all night long. If you close your window, it's no problem, otherwise it's quite noisy. If you are not staying for too long an like to live in modern and well kept place, the Moevempick should be your choice.
reviews.title: Great stay for a layover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel close to the Franfurt Messe area; about 5 minutes walk from the Conference hall. The hotels surrounding area was pretty ordinary. We arrived late and were upgraded to executive suites on the top floor at no extra costs. Excellent rooms, with free Wi-Fi. The hotel has a very nice restaurant. The breakfast table is probably one of the best I have experienced.
reviews.title: Much more hospitality than ever imaginable

reviews.text: Stayed one day in the hotel. Like the room with cool design and it is big. Room-Service wasnt great, they have forgotten the order and breakfast in room wasnt good - bad caffee, breat boring. Good located for a business trip. Expensive parking (27 EUR!)
reviews.title: short business trip in frankfurt

reviews.text: I had previously worked in Frankfurt for a year, and on my return visits I have stayed in the Marriott and the Intercontinental, but this hotel, while a 4 star hotel, bettered the 2 5 star hotels. I got an unbelievable rate of €49/night from Hotels.com. Recommended.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was such a great stay. The staff went above & beyond their call of duty from the front desk clerks to the bar tenders & wait staff. We enjoyed our stay & would definitely revisit this hotel if ever in Frankfurt again. We checked in quite early ( around 11:00 am) as our International flight arrived earlier than expected but that never seemed to present a problem at check-in as they accomodated us with great warmth & professionalism. The room & entire hotel is very modern & clean. The restaurant & bar have good food, drinks and service. The hotel is quite convenient to the Transit system, just a short 5-10 min walk to subway, trolleys & train station. They helped us with train travel info. & tours at the front desk. Every morning the cleaning crew left you candy on your pillow. Their coffee is delicious and the bar area is open late for food & drinks. Everyone spoke English very well & were willing to assist us in any way we needed. Free Internet service in Lobby helped us keep connected to loved ones in the States and was available anytime. So all in all this was a wonderful hotel, affordable and the location was great. It had a nice exercise facility and a rooftop outdoor area for city sights. The room was so well insulated that we never heard a noise during night hours. Made for comfortable sleeping! They are going to start construction accross the hotel for shopping & restaurants so I imagine this location will be in even greater demand in the future. Most everything is a la carte, so bring your Euros, but otherwise you will enjoy this stay. Would recommend for couples or business travelers... :)
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a business type hotel but is great because you feel there is a genuine worry that your stay is perfect. It is 4 blocks from the subway that takes you everywhere. It was pretty cold but it didn't really bother. We spent Christmas in this town and it was really romantic (which we weren't expecting to be). I would definitely recommend and go back next time.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and spacious

likes.disliked: — The first room didn't have water in the shower. They changed us imediatly to one that was OK.

reviews.text: I have stayed in that hotel on numerous occasions and it is now my favorite due to ample free parking on the street (once in a while, it's full, but not often) since it is in an uncrowded part of Frankfurt. Although it is a little far from the touristy parts of the city, I've come to appreciate its quietness as well as the abundance of amenities. Free Wi-Fi comes to mind.
reviews.title: Finally, a place that doesn't nickle and dime you!

likes.liked: — Free Wi-Fi, Great Breakfast, Spacious Room, Very Modern, Decent Parking in Front

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a mere $60 a night thanks to Priceline. The hotel is not very well located unless you are attending a conference/trade show at the Frankfurt Messe. It is an older hotel. The facilities and overall appeal are decent. The staff was very friendly and acoomodating considering that we checked into the hotel at 10am in the morning. The rooms were on the smaller side. There is not much in the immediate surrounding area in terms of additional neighborhood amenities.
reviews.title: OK Facilities / Great Service / Fantastic Overall Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: conference hotel next to the exhibition center; clean and well-sized room, friendly staff. Free parking in front of the hotel on the street (at least during the weekend).
reviews.title: clean and comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Good location: very convenient to public trans (be wary if you're headed to the airport on a Sunday morning - you might be better off with a cab.)
reviews.title: Almost everything we needed

reviews.text: Staff was wonderful, automatically greeted me in English when I checked in: explained all the amenities of the hotel, provided a detailed map and explained our location in relation to the city's main points of interest.
reviews.title: Perfect business hotel

reviews.text: We didn't get a chance to try the restaurant - it looked like a little more than we wanted to spend. There were some bakeries and coffee shops in the direction of the Hauptbahnhoff though, and that's what we did for breakfasts.
reviews.title: An Okay Stay!!

description: Whether you are planning to visit Frankfurt on a business trip to attend or host a conference, or on vacation to enjoy one of Germany’s finest cities, the modern and comfortable Mövenpick Hotel Frankfurt City is the perfect choice for you and your party.Easily reached by train or Metro from the airport, the Mövenpick Hotel Frankfurt City is ideally located next to the fairground and vis-à- vis the new shopping centre Skyline Plaza; to offer you the perfect balance between convenience and executive level business facilities. For successful business events, a new-generation conference centre is at your disposal. For outings, take the nearby metro to visit the charming old city of Frankfurt.
